answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Triglycerides are a type of fat that helps the body with providing energy. However, high triglycerides can raise the risk of heart disease and may be a sign of metabolic syndrome. High triglycerides can also be caused by other conditions, such as: obesity, poorly controlled diabetes, hypothyroidism, Kidney disease, drinking a lot of alcohol, side effect of certain medications ( steroids, diuretics and beta-blockers). In some cases, it can run in families and genetic in nature. Check with your doctor for proper management. Aside from lifestyle changes and healthy diet, prescription medicines to help lower your triglycerides may be indicated. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I have triglycerides lavel 450 now, one year back it was 685 ,I started eating nutrious food (Low fat ) alongwith lot of salmon fish & could reduce my triglycerides upto 350 in an year , but again it is gone to 450 (reduced taking salmon fish).LDL is bit higher & HDL is bit lower, I have regular pain at Kidney side but rest of the blood & urine test are OK.even my eye site gone weaker ,I feel pain when I use glass ( even after doctors checked glasses) ,What could be the basic cause ,what is the remedyRavi Ranjan Sharma***@****+91-9810033631
title: Triglycerides lavel 685
